snippet: The Georgian forces operate in perhaps the most dangerous part of the country, helping to fill a void left by United States troops who have been pulling out.
abstract: Suicide bomber driving a truck packed with explosives attacks isolated base staffed by Georgian troops in Afghanistan's Helmand Province, killing seven soldiers.

byline.original: By ALISSA J. RUBIN and TAIMOOR SHAH

lead_paragraph: The Georgian forces operate in perhaps the most dangerous part of the country, helping to fill a void left by United States troops who have been pulling out.

headline.seo: Taliban Attack Base Guarded by Georgians in Afghanistan
headline.main: Taliban Attack Kills 7 Georgian Soldiers in Afghanistan
headline.print_headline: Truck Bomb Kills 7 Georgian Soldiers in Afghanistan
